subdisciplines.name: High Energy Physics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the most fundamental particles and interactions in the universe at very high energies.

subdisciplines.name: Particle Physics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the behavior and properties of subatomic particles, including the discovery of new particles and the measurement of their properties.

subdisciplines.name: Astroparticle Physics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the highest energy particles in the universe, including cosmic rays and neutrinos, and their interactions with matter and radiation.

subdisciplines.name: Accelerator Physics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the design, construction, and operation of particle accelerators, which are used to generate high-energy particles for research purposes.

subdisciplines.name: Theoretical High Energy Physics
subdisciplines.description: The development of mathematical models and theories to explain the behavior of subatomic particles at very high energies.
